Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area Director at.

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
On 01/21/2025, Staff 3 can be seen shoving Youth A to the
ground. Youth A does not have any injuries.
Allegation 2:
01/23/2025, Staff 4 can be seen throwing Youth B down on the
ground face first. Youth B was not injured.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
An interview was attempted with Youth A face-to-face at the
facility on 2/12/2025 however following consultant and MDHHS
staff introductions, he exited the room and declined to return.
Youth A confirmed with a nod that he did not wish to enter the
room to participate. On 3/6/2025 Youth A again declined to enter
the room and confirmed verbally that he did not wish to be
interviewed.
Program Director was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Program Director reported that following review of the incident
reports and video footage of these restraints, Program Director
advised the chief administrator the restraints in her opinion, the
restraints were improperly done.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. Youth C denied any knowledge of
incidents involving Youth A or Youth B in which they were
restrained. Youth C reported that staff always intervene to break
up fights with youth by sending youth to their rooms to separate
them. Youth C reported that Staff 4 is nice and denied witnessing
any staff, including Staff 4, harm any youth during a restraint or
otherwise.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face on 3/6/2025 at the facility
along with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she recalled the
restraint involving Youth A. Staff 2 reported it took place in the
2

hallway outside of the first-floor lounge after another youth
slapped Youth A on the neck. Staff 2 reported staff directed Youth
A out into the hallway and he complied at which time Youth A
began pushing the staff. Staff 2 reported the staff present were
Staff 2 and Staff 3 and they were attempting to verbally
deescalate Youth A at which time Youth A began pushing to get
back into the lounge. Staff 2 reported that at this time Staff 2 and
Staff 3 put Youth A in a high standing restraint where staff hold the
youths wrists from either side. Staff 2 reported that during the
restraint Youth A dropped to the floor at which time staff released
Youth A. Staff 2 reported that Staff 7 switched places with Staff 2.
When Youth A got back up he began pushing again so another
high standing restraint was engaged and Youth A dropped to the
floor a second time so staff released their hold. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A got up from the floor again and was still escalated
attempting to get into the door and push against staff at which
time staff attempted to use more verbal de-escalation to redirect
Youth A by asking Youth A to talk to them and tell them calmy
what was wrong. When offered to go outside for a walk, Staff 2
went to retrieve Youth A’s coat. Staff 2 reported when the coat
was brought Youth A calmed down and agreed to stay calm and
go on a walk with Staff 3. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not
harmed during the restraint and had no marks nor did he complain
of any pain during or after.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face on 3/6/2025 at the facility
along with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported that he did not recall
the restraint with Youth A. Staff 3 reported he knows he has been
involved in restraints with Youth A however did not initially
recollect this particular incident. Staff 3 denied any youth being
hurt during any restraints he has been involved in. Staff 3 reported
the staff attempt to calm youth down verbally. At this point in the
interview Staff 3 said he vaguely remembered the incident with
Youth A. Staff 3 reported he remembered getting Youth A to walk
away from an escalating situation with another youth and that from
the hallway Youth A was attempting to push back into the room.
Staff 3 reported that they utilized a team control restraint which is
where one staff on either side of the youth hold their arms. When
the youth flail or fall to the ground, staff release them. Staff 3
reported no concerns with this restraint and denied that Youth A
was harmed. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 was present.
Staff 7 was interviewed by telephone on 3/12/25 along with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 denied any recollection of a restraint with
Youth A or Youth B. Staff 7 reported Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4
are great staff members and denied having any concerns with
their treatment of youth. Staff 7 denied witnessing any staff
member improperly restrain any youth or cause harm to a youth
3

during a restraint. Staff 7 denied seeing Youth A or Youth B with
any marks or bruises.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/25
along with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported that he recalled both
youth A being restrained outside the lounge and Youth B being
restrained in the gym. Youth E was not able to provide any details
as he could not recall what staff were involved in either restraint
as he could not see them well. Youth E denied knowledge if either
youth were hurt during the restraints.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 4/2/25. Staff 8 reported that
he and Staff 3 were with Youth A in the hallway after directing him
to leave the lounge where he was attempting to get into an
altercation with the youth who hit him in the neck with a piece of
plastic. Staff 8 reported that he and Staff 3 utilized verbal
redirection and also held onto Youth A with their hands on his
wrists. Staff 8 denied this being a restraint. The consultant at this
time provided Consultation that what he was describing was a two
man hold and was a restraint. Staff 8 reported that he did not
believe at the time that it was and clarified that this is why the
incident report he wrote did not indicate that it was a restraint.
Staff 8 denied that Youth A was ever pushed, shoved, or thrown to
the ground. Staff 8 denied Youth A having an injury from the
restraint. Staff 8 reported that when Youth A would drop to the
floor neither staff kept their hands on him.
Video Review:
• Video footage of the incident dated 1/21/25 involving Youth
A shows 4 minutes 41 seconds of the hallway outside of
the first-floor lounge. Video footage shows three staff
present; Staff 2, Staff 7, and Staff 3. The view of the
restraint does not allow for confirmation of a proper two-
person restraint although there are staff on either side of
the youth and staff are not holding the youth each time
Youth A drops to the floor. There is no visual evidence of
staff forcing, pushing, or pulling youth A to the floor.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/21/25 regarding Youth A detailed
the incident in the hallway outside of the first-floor lounge.
The incident report indicated Youth A began an altercation
in the lounge after being hit in the back of the neck by
another youth. Youth A was escorted to the hallway by
Staff 2 and Staff 7.
• MISACWIS incident report 205740239 regarding the same
incident as above provides additional details that a standing
4

two-person restraint was done with Staff 2 and Staff 3
multiple times. This incident report stated Staff 2 switched
places with Staff 7 and the two-person standing restraint
continued. The report indicated Youth A would go to the
floor and staff would release each time. The incident report
stated staff involved attempted verbal de-escalation.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported he did remember
a time being restrained that may have occurred around 3 weeks
prior in the gym. Youth B reported he did not remember anyone
who was there and could not name any staff or youth who
participated or witnessed the restraint. Youth B reported it was a
restraint that he was on the ground for. Youth B reported he was
restrained in order to protect himself from hurting himself when he
was hitting his head against things. Youth B reported he got a
bruise on his right hand from this incident when he was flailing on
the ground. Youth B showed the consultant and MDHHS staff his
hand, there was no visible mark or bruise in the area being shown.
Youth B reported there were 4 staff present. Youth B did not recall
any staff throwing him or shoving him to the ground during the
restraint. Youth B reported that he feels safe at the facility.
Program Director was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Program Director reported that following review of the incident
reports and video footage of these restraints, Program Director
advised the chief administrator that in her opinion, they were
improperly done.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. Youth C denied any knowledge of
incidents involving Youth A or Youth B in which they were
restrained. Youth C reported that staff always intervene to break
up fights with youth by sending youth to their rooms to separate
them. Youth C reported that Staff 4 is nice and denied witnessing
any staff, including Staff 4, harm any youth during a restraint or
otherwise.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/25/2025 along with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported that on the date Youth B was
restrained it occurred because he was throwing a basketball at
other youth and escalating. Staff 4 reported verbal redirection was
attempted and failed so a supine restraint was done. Staff 4
5

reported that the supine lasted long enough for Youth A to calm
down. Staff 4 denied causing physical harm to Youth B during the
incident, and denied pushing, pulling, or throwing the youth to the
ground. Staff 4 denied any concerns of abuse by any staff at the
facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face on 3/6/2025 at the facility
along with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he remembered the
incident with Youth B. Staff 3 reported the incident report on this
restraint came to Staff 3 for debriefing. Staff 3 said he did not have
concerns with this restraint and denied any knowledge that Youth
B was thrown to the ground. Staff 3 reported there were no
complaints from Youth B of injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 3/12/ along with MDHHS
Worker. Staff 2 reported she did recall the restraint in the gym with
Youth B. Staff 2 reported Youth B was attempting to fight another
youth after exchanging remarks to one another. Staff 2 reported
staff separated them by standing between them at which time
Youth B began pushing staff. Staff 2 reported Staff 4 and Staff 5
put Youth B’s in a restraint. Staff 2 reported that she attempted to
verbally redirect Youth B. Staff 2 said Youth B continued to
escalate by moving towards staff and pushing them. Staff 2
reported Youth B was then put in a supine restraint. Staff 2
reported she did not see Staff 4 push Youth B to the ground. Staff
2 asked Youth B if he was okay when it was over, and youth B
replied that he was okay.
Staff 5 was interviewed via video conference on 3/12/2025 along
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported he remembered that Youth
B was being violent and was therefore restrained. Staff 5 reported
he heard no mention of Youth B being injured from the restraint.
Staff 5 reported that when youth are escalated, they attempt to
calm them down verbally and by staying calm themselves. Staff 5
denied knowledge that Youth B was thrown to the ground. Staff 5
reported he removed the remaining youth out of the area and did
not witness Youth B being placed on the ground.
Staff 6 was interviewed via video conference on 3/12/25 along
with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 6 denied that the
restraint done with Youth B was done incorrectly and denied that
the youth was harmed. Staff 6 did not remember who gave the
directive to do a supine restraint. Staff 6 reported that Staff 4, Staff
2, Staff 3, and Staff 6 were present. Staff 6 reported there should
be 4 people doing a supine and that there were 4 people. It should
be noted that Staff 6 reported both that the restraint was done
correctly at the start of the interview and then stated that Staff 2
caused the restraint to be done incorrectly when she left the
6

restraint leaving 3 staff present. This sentence and the highlighted
one above and in the prior section are contradictory. Can you
explain? Staff 6 reported that there was a training after this
incident to discuss how to do supine restraints correctly.
Staff 7 was interviewed by telephone on 3/12/25 along with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 denied any recollection of a restraint with
Youth B. Staff 7 reported Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 are great
staff members and denied having any concerns with their
treatment of youth. Staff 7 denied witnessing any staff member
improperly restrain any youth or cause harm to a youth during a
restraint. Staff 7 denied seeing Youth B with any marks or bruises.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported that he remembered
when Youth B was restrained in the gym. Youth D reported he
saw when Youth B was put in a supine restraint where the youth is
on the floor and that it was wrong because there were 3 people
when there should have been 5. Youth D reported he knew they
did it wrong because he saw from the hallway that there were only
3 people. Youth D reported Staff 2, Staff 5, Staff 4, and Staff 3
were there. Youth D reported he was being directed out of the
gym but could still see what was going on as he was walking out.
Youth D reported he saw that two staff were on either side of him
and he was taken to the ground with one staff on each arm. Youth
D reported while on the ground Youth B was hitting his head on
the floor.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/25
along with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported that he recalled both
youth A being restrained outside the lounge and Youth B being
restrained in the gym. Youth E was not able to provide any details
as he could not recall what staff were involved in either restraint
and reported that he could not see them well. Youth E denied
knowledge if either youth were hurt during the restraints.
Video Review:
• Video footage of the incident dated 1/23/25 involving Youth
B shows 1 minute and 51 seconds of the gym at Wolverine
Center. Video footage shows Staff 4 clearly identifiable.
Video footage shows Staff 4 attempting to intervene when
Youth B attempts to charge through him by grabbing Youth
B’s wrist in his left hand. Staff 4 is seen holding Youth B’s
wrist for several seconds while Youth B goes to the floor
and gets back up. Video footage shows Youth B transition
to the floor during which time it appears Youth B transitions
7

to the floor in a restraint. Video shows 3 staff involved in the
hold until the end of the video.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/22/25 regarding Youth B detailed
the incident in the gym. The report indicated Staff 4, Staff 2,
Staff 3 and Staff 6 were involved when Youth B was
attempting to throw basketballs at another youth and
continued to escalate until he was restrained in a supine
restraint.
• MISACWIS incident report 205860240 detailed the restraint
done in the gym with Youth B. Staff involved are noted to
be Staff 4, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 5, and Staff 6. Incident
report detailed that Youth B escalated and attempted to
fight another youth, that the other youth were all moved out
of the gym. Youth B was then placed in an emergency
supine for approximately 5 minutes.
• Employee Counseling Form dated 1/27/25 regarding Staff
4. This form detailed Staff 4’s termination of employment
with the reason cited being for completing the restraint on
1/22/25, improperly.
Policies and procedures
• The Policy details Behavior Support and Management and
procedure. It dictates that restraints should only be utilized
when necessary and appropriately.
Analysis Allegation 1:
A violation is not established regarding this allegation. It was
denied by staff and youth that Youth A was thrown to the floor or
shoved by staff. Review of video footage shows no evidence of
Youth A being shoved or thrown to the floor by staff.
Allegation 2:
A violation is not established for this allegation. There is no visual
proof of Staff 4 forcefully pulling or pushing Youth B to the ground
for the supine hold.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth Restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
8

condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
Youth A was thrown to the floor. Youth A was placed in a team
control and a standing restraint, and they both were done
incorrectly.
Allegation 2:
Youth B was placed in an improper restraint in the gym by Staff 2
and Staff 4. The restraint that Youth B was placed in required five
people and was only done with three people.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
As indicated above interviews were attempted with Youth A on
2/12/2025 and 3/6/2025 but he declined to be interviewed.
Program Director was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25. As
indicated above the Program Director reported that the restraint
with Youth A was done incorrectly.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Youth C did not
report any concerns regarding restraints conducted with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face on 3/6/2025 at the facility
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 2 did not
report any concerns with the restraint with Youth A, reporting that
the restraints were done appropriately with no injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face on 3/6/2025 at the facility
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 3 did not
report any concerns with the restraint with Youth A, reporting that
the restraints were done appropriately with no injuries.
Staff 7 was interviewed by telephone on 3/12/25 along with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 denied witnessing the restraint with Youth
A and did not report any concerns reporting with any restraints
done in the facility.
9

Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/25
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above, Youth E recalled
Youth A being restrained however did not witness the restraint
and did not have knowledge of any injuries.
Staff 8 was interviewed via phone on 4/2/25. As indicated above
Staff 8 denied that there were any concerns regarding this
restraint or that it was done improperly.
Video Review:
• Video footage of incident dated 1/21/25 involving
Youth A shows 4 minutes 41 seconds of the hallway
outside of the first-floor lounge. Video footage shows
three staff present; Staff 2, Staff 7, and Staff 3. The
view of the restraint does not allow for confirmation
of a proper two-person restraint although there are
staff on either side of the youth and staff are not
holding the youth each time Youth A drops to the
floor. There is no visual evidence of staff forcing,
pushing, or pulling youth A to the floor.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/21/25 written by Staff 8
regarding Youth A’s incident in the hallway outside
of the first-floor lounge. The incident report denied
that a restraint was done.
• MISACWIS incident report 205740239 regarding the
same incident as above provides additional detailed
that a standing two-person restraint was done with
Staff 2 and Staff 3 multiple times. This incident
report stated Staff 2 switched places with Staff 7 and
the two-person standing restraint continued. This
incident report stated Youth A would go to the floor
and staff would release each time. Incident report
stated staff involved attempted verbal de-escalation.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
During Youth B’s interview on 2/12/2025 he could not remember
details of any restraint but he did state he recalled a restraint in
which he was on the ground. He stated this restraint was done by
4 staff and was done correctly.
Program Director was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Program Director reported that following review of the incident
reports and video footage of these restraints, Program Director
10

advised the chief administrator that in her opinion, the restraints
were improperly done.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/10/25.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/12/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Youth C did not
report any concerns regarding restraints conducted with Youth B.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/25/2025 along with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported that on the date Youth B was
restrained it occurred because he was throwing a basketball at
other youth and escalating. Staff 4 reported verbal redirection was
attempted and failed so a supine restraint was done. Staff 4
reported that he informed Staff 2 that a supine restraint was
necessary. Staff 4 reported that the supine lasted long enough for
Youth A to calm down. Staff 4 did not know how long that was.
Staff 4 reported that Staff 3 was called to the scene after the
restraint was in place. Staff 4 reported he followed protocol to
complete the restraint. Staff 4 reported he was terminated after
this restraint because management stated it was not done
correctly. Staff 4 denied any concerns of improper restraint by any
other staff at the facility. Staff 4 reported Staff 5 and Staff 6 were
present for the restraint.
Staff 3 reported that a supine restraint requires 4 people and he
recalled that there were 4 people listed on the incident report.
Staff 3 said he did not have concerns with this restraint. Staff 3
reported that there were no complaints from Youth B of injuries.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 3/12/ along with MDHHS
Worker. As indicated above Staff 2 reported she did recall the
restraint in the gym with Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 4 and Staff
5 grabbed Youth B’s arms in a restraint. Staff 2 said Youth B
continued to escalate by moving towards staff and pushing them.
Staff 2 reported Staff 4 then called for a supine restraint. Staff 5
and Staff 4 grabbed Youth B’s arms and Staff 2 escorted the
remaining youth from the gym. Staff 2 reported that she instructed
Staff 5 and Staff 4 to release Youth B once he was calm. Staff 2
said everything was happening quickly, and she was not sure why
she allowed the restraint to continue with less than 4 people. Staff
2 reported Youth B was not harmed during this restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed via video conference on 3/12/2025 along
with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 5 denied
witnessing any improper restraints at the facility. Staff 5 reported
that Staff 4 started the supine so remaining staff supported the
11

restraint. Staff 5 reported that after this restraint staff were
retrained on how to do supine restraints properly as this one was
not done properly. Staff 5 reported that he now knows that a
supervisor has to call a supine and if a supine is not needed, they
do not have to support the supine if called by another staff.
Staff 6 was interviewed via video conference on 3/12/25 along
with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 6 denied that the
restraint done with Youth B was done incorrectly and denied that
the youth was harmed. Staff 6 did not remember who gave the
directive to do a supine restraint. Staff 6 reported that Staff 4, Staff
2, Staff 3, and Staff 6 were present. Staff 6 reported there should
be 4 people doing a supine and that there were 4 people. It should
be noted that Staff 6 reported both that the restraint was done
correctly at the start of the interview and then stated that Staff 2
caused the restraint to be done incorrectly when she left the
restraint leaving 3 staff present. Staff 6 reported that there was a
training after this incident to discuss how to do supine restraints
correctly.
Staff 7 was interviewed by telephone on 3/12/25 along with
MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Staff 7 denied any
recollection of a restraint with Youth B. Staff 7 denied witnessing
any staff member improperly restrain any youth or cause harm to
a youth during a restraint.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/2025
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Youth D reported
he saw Youth B put in a supine restraint where the youth is on the
floor and that it was wrong because there were 3 people when
there should have been 5. Youth D reported he knew they did it
wrong because he saw from the hallway that there were only 3
people.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/13/25
along with MDHHS Worker. As indicated above Youth E was not
able to provide any details as he could not recall what staff were
involved in either restraint and reported that he could not see them
well.
Video Review:
• Video footage of incident dated 1/23/25 involving
Youth B shows 1 minute and 51 seconds of the gym
at Wolverine Center. Video footage shows Staff 4
clearly identifiable. Video footage shows Staff 4
attempting to intervene when Youth B attempts to
charge through him by grabbing his wrist in his left
hand. Staff 4 is shown holding his wrist through
12

several seconds while Youth B goes to the floor and
gets back up. Video footage shows Youth B
transition to the floor. Video shows 3 staff involved in
the hold until the end of the video.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/22/25 written by Staff 2
regarding Youth B detailed the incident in the gym.
The report indicated Staff 4, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff
6 were involved. The incident report further noted
that Youth B was attempting to throw basketballs at
another youth and continued to escalate until he was
restrained in a supine restraint.
• MISACWIS incident report 205860240 detailed the
restraint done in the gym with Youth B. Staff
involved are noted to be Staff 4, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff
5, and Staff 6. Incident indicated Youth B escalated
and attempted to fight another youth, that the other
youth were all moved out of the gym. The incident
report further stated Youth B was placed in an
emergency supine restraint for approximately 5
minutes.
• Employee Counseling Form dated 1/27/25 regarding
Staff 4. This form detailed Staff 4’s termination of
employment with the reason cited being for
completing the restraint on 1/22/25 improperly.
• Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 5, and Staff 6 received a
refresher training on conducting the Supine restraint
on 1/27/25 and 1/28/25.
Policies and procedures
• The CPI Manual Holding Skills Workbook was reviewed
regarding Floor Transition: Standing to Emergency Floor
Holding: Supine details that there should be a staff at the
head, arms, and two at the legs during an emergency
supine restraint. This would require at least 4 staff
providing one staff was able to support both arms by
themself.
• The facility’s BSM Policy & Procedure for CPI in
Residential Programs was reviewed. The policy details that
CPI is the approved restraint model at the facility.
• Requirement for Supervisor to call a Supine was not
documented in any policy, procedure or in the CPI manual.
Analysis Allegation 1:
13

There is no violation established regarding this allegation as it
pertains to this licensing rule. It was consistently reported by staff
and youth that no one witnessed this restraint being done
improperly. It was confirmed with each staff interview who was
present that there was a staff on each side of the youth during
moments of restraint and that when the youth went to the ground
he was released.
Allegation 2:
A violation is established regarding this allegation as it pertains to
this licensing rule. It was consistently reported by staff present that
the supine restraint was done incorrectly including by staff 4, who
was reportedly terminated following this incident. It was reported
by staff that this restraint should not occur without being called by
a supervisor and a supervisor did not call this restraint however it
was carried out when Staff 4 called for it to be done. Upon video
review of the supine restraint, it appears there are only 3 staff
present and this restraint requires at least 4 people.
It was further confirmed through video footage review that Staff 4
had hands around Youth B’s wrist outside of an appropriate
restraint.
